### Tender Announcement for M50 Room 066 Modifications

#### Project Overview

The National Research Council Canada (NRC) is seeking proposals for the construction of modifications to Room 066 in Building M50 at the Montreal Road Campus.

##### Proposed Scope of Work

* Modifications to Room 066
* Installation of new mechanical systems in Building M50

#### Mandatory Requirements and Conditions

* Attendance at a site visit is mandatory for bidders.
* Bidders must provide identification and proof of business registration upon signing the Mandatory Site Visit Attendance Form.

#### Security Clearance

* Bidders must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) issued by the Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CISD), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).
* Subcontractors must also hold a valid RELIABILITY STATUS granted or approved by CISD/PWGSC.
* A valid Workplace Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB) Certificate is required.

#### Tender Documents and Bidding Instructions

* Tender documents can be obtained from Buyandsell.gc.ca TMA services provider.
* Addenda will be distributed by Buyandsell.gc.ca TMA service provider when issued.
* Firms electing to base their bids on tender documents obtained from other sources do so at their own risk.

#### Tender Submission and Evaluation

* Tender submissions must be received by October 4, 2022, 14:00.
* Tender results will be sent by email to all contractors who submitted a tender.

#### Dispute Resolution and Contract Administration

* Disputes or claims arising from the contract will be resolved through negotiations between the parties' representatives.
* The Procurement Ombudsman has the authority to resolve disputes and complaints related to the administration of the contract.

#### Contact Information

* Departmental Representative: Mark O'Connor, mark.oconnor@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca, (613) 301-3576
* Contracting Authority: Collin Long, collin.long@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca (613) 993-8956

### Note for Potential Bidders

The NRC is committed to providing a safe and secure working environment. All contractors and subcontractors are required to meet the mandatory security and WSIB clearance requirements outlined in this tender.

Please ensure that all personnel assigned to the project have the required level of security clearance.
